captions.text: I get around 4-5 hours sleep a night
5 hours of sleep. three to four hours of sleep. five hours a night
work then you go home and eat something then like
10-2 or three is a all the other stuff
I live far away so I get home late, I also like try to make time to workout
I just have really bad insomnia and I tend to over extend myself so when I do
do have the time to sleep a full night I just don't know how to even begin sleeping
to me, sleep is just something that you have to do so the quicker that
you get it over with, the better
I do worry it
at what point will the make up sort of stop covering up my lack of sleep
I think I look sort of exhausted under my eyes
baggy and my eyes look a little blood shot and my
skin kind of looks dull... there's definitely times when I wake up and
feel like look older... I noticed that I don't get enough sleep because the
first thing I think of when I wake up
is coffee... I am trying to change my sleeping habits because I know
detrimental to my health and my appearance... I will never change my sleeping habits
I will just figure out more ways to ingest caffeine
OMG I'm so scared,  I don't want to open my eyes... I sort of I recognize myself
but I don't at all.... COOL!
Oh, close-up it's gross. I think it's more disturbing because I
look younger than expected but still terrible
my skin both looks and feels tired
definitely don't love how I look. I hate the under eyes, man
The under eyes are the worst... This is the first time I've ever seen myself with
wrinkles, I don't like it.
I didn't expect the wrinkles under my eyes.
I look really pale, I don't like a happy healthy person right now
I said nothing would make me change my sleeping habits
I think I'm a little convinced.
See myself with all those wrinkles above my eyelids.
I definitely feel less invincible
I realized now that these bad habits are going to catch up to me at
some point... it definitely makes me want to change my sleeping habits
i'd don't know if I'm actually going to...it definitely makes me wanna sleep
more if this is what i'm gonna look like.
A certain melancholy to the overall look that
off putting.. I think that's worse, that projection
to the world to look like someone who's sad that
startling, also makes me wanna sleep

title: How Does Sleep Affect Your Face?

comments.author: Alec Roberts

comments.text:
It's sad because I have 2 lessons a day (exept for Sunday for obvious 
reasons and Thursday, which I have an after school and one lesson). I have 
a total of 11 lessons a week, excluding school and aftershcool. So every 
weekday, I get up at 6 am, school starts at 7 and ends at 3 pm. I get home, 
do both lessons, shower, eat dinner, and barely start doing homework at 8 
pm. And for me, I have school homework plus homework for 2 lessons that I 
have the next day. 2 of the lessons I have is 1.5 hours at 6 pm, but the 
teacher usually comes 10-30 minutes late, which means ending late, usually 
at 8 pm... This kind of lifestyle is taking a big toll on me, depriving me 
of sleep so I have bags under my eyes during school and lessons, and it's 
getting more noticable that I am getting too little sleep. I tend to fall 
asleep in class and during lesson... now I just wish that the future would 
come quickly when I am on my deathbed, without a care in the world 
anymore...﻿

comments.author: caitlin martin

comments.text:
I've been experimenting with my sleep cycle for some time now. When I was 
in high school, I would fall asleep around 9:00PM or 10:00PM and wake up 
around 6:00AM or 7:00AM interchangeably. Now that I'm older, I fall asleep 
around 9:30PM or 10:00PM and when I wake up around 7:00AM for an entire 
week, I progressively feel more tired. Nine hours of sleep is too much for 
me, so I sleep around 8 hours a day with a few naps in-between whenever I 
can manage to squeeze those in my schedule. Needless to say, too much sleep 
can be a bad thing, as well!﻿

comments.author: Jennifer Rimada

comments.text:
I almost always get at least 8 hours of sleep, but I look extremely sleep 
deprived. I have absolutely HORRIBLE under eye circles. I have never ever 
seen anyone with under-eyes as bad as mine, which is sad, because I sleep 
more than most people my age. Like, i can't stress how bad they are. 
They're SO dark, and my eyes are really puffy. It's frustrating because the 
only time they go away is when i get about 11 hours, which is totally 
unreasonable. Anyone else have this problem? It's definitely one of my 
biggest insecurities, I hate it so much. Any info on how to get rid of 
these bad boys is much appreciated :)﻿

comments.author: buck9393

comments.text:
I'm 17 and I'm chronically sleep deprived. I've slept for about 4-5 hours 
every night for like 3 years now. I'm extremely tired and I feel depressed 
due the lack of sleep and I physically can't get up anymore at 7. It's 
affecting my school grades and I'm at the "blacklist" because I'm the 
person at school who has been too late the most (52 times in total now) 

I want to change this so much I keep falling asleep during class and it 
sucks I can't concentrate I just want to feel refreshed and organized like 
a normal person. 
But it's so hard to break this cycle, the stress of school just keeps 
accumulating and I have to learn till 3am because my concentration is so 
bad.. I'm too young to be sleep deprives to this degree. I haven't eaten 
breakfast in 2 years. ﻿
